intro: Gouldia sandwicensis var. lanceolata, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame flower, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its vibrant red and orange bracts that surround its small, white flowers, creating a dramatic visual display. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat. It has a compact, shrub-like form with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. This variant is prized for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
